finding: In the context of a clinical trial, a significant improvement in cognitive function was observed in individuals with mild cognitive impairment following a 12-week course of omega-3 fatty acid supplementation, as reported in the Journal of Alzheimer's Disease.

In the context of a population-based study, a strong association was found between exposure to air pollution and the risk of developing dementia, as published in the Journal of the American Geriatrics Society.

In the context of a laboratory study, a novel therapeutic approach using a small molecule inhibitor of a specific enzyme was shown to improve memory and learning in mouse models of Alzheimer's disease, as reported in the Journal of Medicinal Chemistry.
In the context of a genetic study, a rare genetic variant was identified as a protective factor against dementia in a large cohort of individuals, as published in the journal Brain.

In the context of a neuroimaging study, a new imaging biomarker was developed to accurately predict the risk of developing dementia in individuals with mild cognitive impairment, as reported in the journal Alzheimer's & Dementia.
